did.unittitle: Solomon C. Frucht Brooklyn Navy Yard ephemera
did.abstract: Contains ephemera which belonged to Solomon C. Frucht while he was employed by the U.S. Navy at the Brooklyn Navy Yard from 1934 to 1963. The ephemera includes invitations, receipts, and material related to civil service retirement benefits.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Michael and Naomi Frucht, 1987.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Solomon C. Frucht Brooklyn Navy Yard ephemera, 1987.050, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Five commemorative pins were removed to the artifacts collection in 1997. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains ephemera which belonged to Solomon C. Frucht while he was employed by the U.S. Navy at the Brooklyn Navy Yard from 1934 to 1963. The ephemera includes invitations, receipts, and material related to civil service retirement benefits.
